intro: Diellia pallida, commonly known as the pale diellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance.
